website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a great value for unconventional wine glasses, this set is for you.
pros: The design makes them easy to hold and manipulate
cons: Very nontraditional – not made of glass and does not have stems

customer_reviews.title: Not That Great
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews about not putting them in the dishwasher etc. AN figured because I wash everything by hand in my RV that these would be a good buy. First glass is cloudy and hazy after about three hand washes. I have used it to hold wine, water, and fizzy vitamin tablets (Airborne Vitamins). In addition to being too flexible and thin, which I cannot understand how folks think that is cool or good in any way (I was open minded until now) they are just not a good product. Not that great elsewhere if you only want to buy once or buy these and replace them like I am going to do.
customer_reviews.author: Barney Fife

customer_reviews.title: I Love These Glasses, but they're kinda "dainty" ....
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I love these glasses. I used them the first time at the Epcot Food & Wine Festival. You got the glass [full of wine] and people were THROWING THEM AWAY. I kept mine. ALL OF THEM. Then I ordered more. They're small (well, 12 oz of wine ....), the have a lovely little finger holder and they're unbreakable (important in my house). I love them. BUT they're not QUITE dishwasher safe. They lose their nice round rim. Obviously I still drink out of them, but I'd personally say hand wash them and don't squish them in your strainer between other things.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Very Delicate
customer_reviews.text: FYI, These are drinking glasses but they are not glass. I knew this when I ordered but I wanted to highlight this to the potential buyers out there. They are a soft plastic/nylon type material. You ""CAN NOT"" wash in the dishwasher or allow them to be exposed to high temps, probably no more than guessing 80 F degrees (Fahrenheit). Do not use any abrasive wash cloth, I use soap and water with my hand to prevent scratches. Cold beverages only. Great for parties where the possibility of the glass being dropped and no worry of breakage. I would buy again. But the price on these glasses fluctuate somewhat so monitor the price. I paid $10.36 US
customer_reviews.author: Yea I Bought It

customer_reviews.title: Look good..feel good at first...but
customer_reviews.text: If you even apply a tiny bit of pressure to these, they bend. They are too flexible. I bought them for use in our yard by the pool, but they are so lightweight they feel disposable and I'm afraid that guests will just toss them in the trash thinking they are not reusable. A solo cup is much sturdier. I am returning them.
customer_reviews.author: MJC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Glamping!
customer_reviews.text: Was tired of breaking wine glasses while RV camping. However I like drinking wine from a nice glass. While they are not as good as nice wine glasses, I like these better than cheap (real glass) wine glasses. I almost want a set for home use. I can see how some people say they feel like disposable plastic cups. But when you're drinking from them, you can't tell. And that's what matters. If you're drinking wine outside, you need these.
customer_reviews.author: Carol P.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Glorified Solo Cups
customer_reviews.text: Not worth what I paid. Never would have purchased in a store if I saw them. The plastic is VERY thin. Flexible is right! The wine "glasses" are stuck in the back of my bar cabinet...I might use them one day.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Not Dishwasher safe
customer_reviews.text: The Cups are nice until you put them in the dishwasher. They apparently are not dishwasher safe as advertised. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: I never drink out of plastic, but when I do...
customer_reviews.text: I nevvvvvver drink out of plastic, especially wine. I'm known to sneak a wine glass out of cabinets at parties where only plastic cups are available, but this cup changed my ways. I actually took it to an outdoor party and turned down the cheapy glass glasses they had, and drank out of my new fav on-the-go wine glass. My friends have made fun of me, the glass snob, but Im all excited someone made a plastic glass I like so much. Great design! High grade plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Magnetic Equator

customer_reviews.title: Brought a Little Class Back To My Home
customer_reviews.text: My wife has Carpal tunnel syndrome (CTS) and we learned very early not to use glasses in our home, while washed she would drop then by accident. So guests always wonder why they would be drinking out of plastic dixie cups even on special occasions. A friend suggested these to me. I bought these to start with and they look great. Clear like glass but shatterproof like plastic. I will be buying all sizes after using these.
customer_reviews.author: Nsiddons

customer_reviews.title: Rugged for something resembling fine glass
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for years and find them amazingly close to fine glassware. After breaking several expensive glass models while hand cleaning, I decided to give these a try --- GREAT. They are very easy to hold and feel good in for hand. I continue to use glass models for dinning or more formal gatherings but, I use these exclusively for casual entertaining or around the pool where glass presents a potential safety issue.
customer_reviews.author: Warbird

customer_reviews.title: Love these glasses. Have bought 4 sets.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 sets of these and love them. We recently bought a houseboat and I bought 2 more sets to put on it. Definitely do not put them in the dishwasher. A relative of ours put one in the dishwasher without my knowledge and it was ruined. Dropped them many times and never a crack or any damage.
customer_reviews.author: R Howard

customer_reviews.title: Thin and cheap.
customer_reviews.text: These are thin and don't stay round at the lip. They become odd shaped. I threw them out and spent a little extra money and bough some very nice thick ones with a heavier base. The Vivocci are much better. Worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Skip Bradlee

customer_reviews.title: Save your glass wine glasses and use these
customer_reviews.text: I do like these because of the fact that they are plastic and that they have the notch for your finger, but the plastic edges where your lips go are a bit sharp and take away from drinking a better wine because of it. If you're having a get-together and want to serve people some wine, but don't want to risk them breaking any nice glasses after having a bit too much to drink, these will work perfectly. The novelty of the finger notch is also cool, and reduces spills when, well, people start to have a bit too much to drink :)
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great glass but never put in dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: I would give it five stars if you could put in dishwasher, but you can't (a family member did and it came out very malformed and unusable). These are lightweight glasses which I like because I hate drinking wine from a glass with a fat rim. The finger indent is a good feature. Overall, a great product but make sure everyone in your household knows not to put in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: RAH

customer_reviews.title: Wife Loves 'em
customer_reviews.text: Bought as Christmas gift for wife, she mentioned them a few months back. She claims it was her favorite gift. They seem rather flimsy to me, but not cheap. And they won't break when you drop them like the Tiffany's wine glass did (ouch!) Can't speak for their durability over time, but they're reasonably priced if we ever need to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: DJJJS

customer_reviews.title: and these seems great for their small size and great design
customer_reviews.text: I bought 12 of these to use at monthly potlucks so that we reduce landfill (I already have many plastic and melamine cups, glasses, plates). While these are pleasing to look at, I'm sure that, given how thin and flexible they are, many people will mistake them for throwaways and do just that. It's just not apparent at all that they are meant to be reused, particularly since they say "recycle" on them. I can't monitor the group of 50-100 attendees, so I'm sure I will start losing them to the trash fairly quickly. Bummer, since I spent quite a bit of time comparing possibilities, and these seems great for their small size and great design.
customer_reviews.author: N. Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Overall - a great product.
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are awesome and usually thrill guests who marvel at the elegant, simple design. They hold a great deal more than one would think and they last forever. The packaging says they are "dishwasher safe" but in my experience they should be washed by hand as the heat from many modern dishwasher tends to warp these glasses.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nonymous

customer_reviews.title: Seem to be quite durable
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used these in our RV for over a year now and they seem quite durable - no cracks or scratches. Handy little indentation for the thumb makes them easy to hold. On the ‘hold’ topic, they will hold a normal sized can of beer with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced. But also, happy with purchase. So..meh
customer_reviews.text: Initially when i opened the package i was dissapointed. Plastic piece of crap. Felt like they cut a plastic coke cottle and said "tada!".y biggest gripe is that it has their website logo stamped on the bottom of the glass. Classy. Its pretty big stamp too. But being the clutz i am, I eventially dropped them and was glad i didnt have an expensive wine glass that would of shattered. Its great if you have a small apt. Want a neat looking glass that looks pretty ok if you can get past the stamp. It seems expensive for how it feels and your basically paying for that neat thumb groove.
customer_reviews.author: SICARIO312

customer_reviews.title: These flexible shatterproof "glasses" are made from plastic
customer_reviews.text: These flexible shatterproof "glasses" are made from plastic. Nice shape and the finger/thumb cut out are a cool design. Not worth the cost to me. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Bought these as a last minute gift... Was embarrassed to giving them.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know who has written all these rave reviews. The design of these cups is a lovely shape, but the plastic -- no other word is accurate -- these are made of is flimsy and cheap feeling. They feel just like those disposable champagne glasses with the fall off bases. I bought these on Prime to take to a house warming, but in all honesty, felt embarrassed to offer them as a gift. For this money, you should be getting a bag of twenty of these, and throwing them out, not offering them as a crystal alternative for rowdy parties.
customer_reviews.author: Truth Speaker

customer_reviews.title: Very practical
customer_reviews.text: Flexible but very nice for the hot tub, poolside and any areas where you don't want to use glass and risk broken glass in these areas. The thumb grip is great for preventing slippage when your hands are wet.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Mann

customer_reviews.title: Love them but wish they were dishwasher safe
customer_reviews.text: Love these glasses. My family have had them for years and I finally just purchased my own. They are nice looking and fit in my hand nicely. I would give them 4.5 stars if I could and only marking it down because I wish they were dishwasher safe. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi R

customer_reviews.title: Ultra Thin, lightweight but would be good for patio, balcony or pool areas.
customer_reviews.text: These shatterproof "glasses" are super thin. VERY lightweight (when your 12 oz soda bottle is empty) light ! They are unique and clear like glass but surprisingly thin and light. Perfect for pool or patio settings to prevent breakage. Not comfortable with the unexpected lightweight and your guest may misjudge that first beverage you've offered them. Hand wash is recommended not dishwasher safe. I thought the glasses would be thicker but this too can be a plus for children handling the glass and the thumb groove is nice.
customer_reviews.author: G man

customer_reviews.title: these are fantastic
customer_reviews.text: these Govino cups are fantastic, hard enough plastic to feel delicate and the thumb indent is brilliant and comfy for holding. They're re-useable (although watch you dont put them in boiling hot dishwasher...if you do, quickly stick a glass bottom when it's still hot and it'll bring the shape back). I bring these to picnics and summer parties along with wine and also have the champagne sized for backpack picnics. love em.
customer_reviews.author: cmmny

customer_reviews.title: A happy spot for your thumb
customer_reviews.text: These "glasses" are great. Myself along with everyone else in my family love the thumb rest. As instructed we have washed them by hand and they are holding up wonderfully. We have taken them along on two trips this summer; the lightweight plastic is perfect for camping and hanging outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Popapotamus

customer_reviews.title: Thumb holder is a nice touch, however we feel these will be thrown ...
customer_reviews.text: Glasses feel flimsy and cheap. Thumb holder is a nice touch, however we feel these will be thrown away if serving at a party.
customer_reviews.author: CJS

customer_reviews.title: best plastic wine glasses in the market
customer_reviews.text: These Govino wine glasses made out of plastic are the best 'fake' wine glasses I can find in the market. I have bought several plastic wine glasses in the past and the problem is, most of them are too thick to enjoy drinking your wine. And what I also like about these ones, they really look like glass ones We normally drink wine out of a Riedel glass. When we are outside for a picnic, going on vacation, on a boat trip, tailgating, these are the ones to bring along! Do not put them in the dishwasher, because the material of these glasses can not handle the heat. You have to hand wash them. That is the only con
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: These funky wine glasses are my new favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I love the new non-glass wine glasses, so I had to give these funky new ones a try! I wasn't sure how I would like the thumb notch - but it gives it a unique look and feel that I really like. These are a great size - I like drinking my red wine out of large glasses, and these are a perfect fit. The material is thin enough to give them a nice quality look and feel, almost as if you were drinking out of actual glass stemless wine glasses - but so thin to seem flimsy or cheap. I used these to drink wine with friends and they were impressed too.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany J

customer_reviews.title: Comfort drinking at its finest.
customer_reviews.text: How cool is this? Great for outdoor drinking because that is when consuming an adult beverage is the best and most refreshing! We love the little dip where you can put your thumb. So it has comfort while drinking! Think of GoVino as your enabler :) My husband and I even use the cup INSIDE!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Schuler

customer_reviews.title: the rim will warp a little out of a perfect circle.
customer_reviews.text: When you have kids the amount of glass you own depleats and you use it less. What doesn't depleat is your intake of wine, etc. Especially during the day at the pool and/or the beach. Now we sip wine in actual wine glasses, not in red cups. Just don't put them in the dishwasher! That's my advice, the rim will warp a little out of a perfect circle.
customer_reviews.author: Jeromy Mount

customer_reviews.title: These will do the job of holding wine but after ...
customer_reviews.text: These will do the job of holding wine but after drinking out of them for a few months the plastic has become somewhat opaque and less clear. On top of the color change, it turns out that I prefer not drinking wine from a plastic cup. I still think they are a solid alternative to shattering glass.
customer_reviews.author: mv

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are awful. As many other reviewers have said, these are one step up from a Solo Cup. The edges are sharp, but hey are not dish washer safe and became warped the first time I washed them. I haven't thrown them away yet but that time is fast approaching. I was very disappointed and frustrated that I spent my good money on them.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn Cisneros

customer_reviews.title: warp easily, otherwise a good product
customer_reviews.text: Shatter proof and a great shape for holding. Pretty, too. BUT they warp and lose their shape even just by handwashing in hot water. We bought them three years ago. They were warped by the end of their first month. Just now, three years later, the first one cracked. Other than the warping, not a bad shelf life. If you get these, you really need to wash only in warm water to avoid mutant shape cups.
customer_reviews.author: JL Wood

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a thin disposable plastic glass
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for use in our RV. At $15 for four glasses I was expecting a decent quality plastic shatterproof glass, but was disappointed. These stemless wine glasses are made of a thin flexible material just slightly better than the disposable glasses you see at weddings. The drinking edge feels thin and sharp and bends easily when pressure is applied. Anyone using them would think they are disposable although they are advertised as reusable if hand washed. They don't look like they will hold up through much use.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Don't get these
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are a great concept, but the manufacturer fell short of 5 stars by not removing the sharp edge on the inside of the rims. I think the unwary drinker has the potential for cutting his lips! After washing a time or two, they are no longer clear and pristine. They take on a cruddy, well-used look which I don't care for, consisting of scratches, smudges and smears that do not go away.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: The perfect solution for the pool or other potlucks!
customer_reviews.text: So, you know the "No Glass at the Pool" rule? These are fantastic for the pool and potlucks! I even wash them in my no-heat dishwasher without a problem. They area a great size, comfortable in the hand (my hands aren't that big), and so inexpensive you don't worry about losing them, although I haven't lost one and I've had them for about a year now. I kept the box and bag wrapping to keep them from getting squashed or scratched in my bag, and they still look like new. I give them to friends when they join our pool as a welcome gift, and they love them too.
customer_reviews.author: Angie's mom

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap wine glasses, not worth the price. I would not use them and look too fragile to use. Tried to return them but they want from $6 to over $12 for postage, depending method used. Do not recommend the $$, time, and effort to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: charlie's mom

customer_reviews.title: Warped in the dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for the pool because they won't shatter like glass. They are definitely NOT dishwasher safe, a fact that I believe is stated but one I overlooked after a pool party and putting all 12 in the dishwasher. They came out warped. I'll replace with heavier plastic at some point and recycle these.
customer_reviews.author: Chica Maria

customer_reviews.title: They are nice enough to serve wine in at dinner and then ...
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are indispensable for outdoor entertaining! Never a worry with this glass around the pool. This is all we use during the summertime. They are nice enough to serve wine in at dinner and then have guests take outside to enjoy a drink by the pool. I have been hand washing these after reading reviews about them becoming spotty in the dishwasher. I accidentally placed a couple in the dishwasher one night and was pleasantly surprised when I took them out and found them crystal clear. I use Cascade and a rinse agent. Not sure if that had anything to do with it, but I now put them in the dishwasher. Would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: PaulieGirl99

customer_reviews.title: Govino! GO VINO!
customer_reviews.text: Purpose: drink wine Pro: Govinos are one of my go-to gifts for my birthdays and hostess gifts. They are light weight, durable, and shatter proof. BEST OF ALL they do not change the wine's taste. Con: Be careful when ordering the 12 oz are much smaller than stemless wine glasses; therefore, go with the 16 oz. They don't do well in the dishwasher either.
customer_reviews.author: Johosm

customer_reviews.title: These are great, but don't put BOILING water into them or ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great, but don't put BOILING water into them or they will deform. It looks like they can handle hot liquids, but nothing right out of a teakettle - 170 degrees F seems about the limit. The good news is that you can re-form them by adding hot water, and reshaping them as they cool. I still love these - no pesky stems to aid in knocking over your wine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So pretty, looks just like glass
customer_reviews.text: These are cute little glasses. I wish I had ordered the 16 ounce size instead of the 12 ounce. I thought 12 ounces sounded like a lot of wine, but it's 12 ounces when you fill it to the top edge. If you and your guests like a generous glass of wine and like to swirl, get the 16 ounce size. The plastic is crystal clear and looks like glass. The notch in the side is a lovely design touch and makes it easy to hold if you're at the pool and have sun lotion on your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Salley

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling and by water
customer_reviews.text: We had 4 of these glasses for over 10 years. They are part of our traveling and tailgate party wine/meal back pack. We are using this multiply time a months. 2 finally cracked on the top. They are not dishwasher safe - No problem. A quick hand wash and you are ready to go. We like that the lip of the glass is thin! Do like to drink out of a glass with a fatter lip. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Debra L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Ultimately happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with these glasses initially. They seemed "flimsy" as they are very flexible. I thought they would be "harder" plastic. But after having them for a few weeks, I've really come to appreciate their flexibility, especially when I've managed to drop one. I believe they truly are indestructible. I bought them because my apartment complex has a rooftop deck where one of the rules is no glass. I enjoy sitting up there with a "glass" of wine in the evening. These are just the ticket.
customer_reviews.author: L. Sell

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it is!! An unbreakable glass.
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT fine crystal, nor were they meant to be. They are unbreakable plastic for use on the patio with a stone floor. The package recommends hand washing so don't put in a dishwasher They are slightly flexible because they are made to be thin and light and they are. I did not find the rims to be sharp or offensive and they display the wine acceptably. Definitely not a plain plastic cup. If you want Riedel or Waterford, look elsewhere and pay more. If you want an unbreakable glass, you could do worse. BTW, the thumb notch makes a good measure for a 6 oz. pour. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for gift baskets I was making up for my married nieces and nephews. I included movies, games, wine, etc and wanted to put a couple of glasses in each box. When they arrived, I thought there must have been a mix up as they looked and felt just like the cheaper plastic glasses you buy at the grocery. It says they are shatterproof and reusable, but I think they would probably begin to get scratched or cloudy after one use. I would have returned them, but I needed them for the gifts that weekend. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: just my opinion

customer_reviews.title: A small child could squeeze them so easily that the opposite edges would touch
customer_reviews.text: These are so flimsy that they aren't worth bothering with. A small child could squeeze them so easily that the opposite edges would touch. Don't waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: khaves

customer_reviews.title: Love these plastic wine glasses!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome plastic wine glasses for by the pool or outside. Not dishwasher safe but hand wash up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Could hurt your mouth.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our boat. And I am returning them. As others say, they are far too thin and "flexible." I suspect they won't hold up for long. Worst of all the lip edge is so rough that one of my guests hurt her mouth drinking from them. While the idea is a good one (and I really liked the finger notch), until these issues are resolve I won't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: L. W. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: love love love these wine glasses
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent for any occasion - we use year round. I often paint with paint pens and give as gifts to our tailgate friends and other wine loving friends who enjoy spending time outdoors or want an easy glass to take with for vacations. Great also for parties and gatherings where you dont want to have broken glasses. Casual, but wine "snobs" appreciate these glasses also. Long lasting also - hand wash/with sponge keeps them fresh and new for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Cardie Dielschneider

customer_reviews.title: Liked at first but not now
customer_reviews.text: Don't use in dishwasher. They marked up and got filmy after so many hand washes. We only use them in our trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am sooooo disappointed. I had a set of these glasses that ...
customer_reviews.text: I am sooooo disappointed. I had a set of these glasses that I absolutely LOVED. I bought these expecting the same thing, used them once, and placed them on the top rack of the dishwasher like my normal procedure. Unfortunately, I did not realize there were 2 different types of these glasses made. THESE ARE NOT DISHWASHER SAFE, even on the top rack. They melted after the 1st use. I realize this was my fault, but it is worthless to me to try to keep track which ones are safe and which aren't, so these are a complete waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindra L.

customer_reviews.title: These may be Shatterproof but they Warp
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment. We bought these for our boat, thinking they would be good all-purpose glasses.They are lightweight and feel good in our hands. I washed them in hot soapy water before taking them to the boat. We used them one time; afterward, I washed them again in hot, soapy water and turned them upside down to dry. The next day, they were warped at the top. We didn't have time to replace them before last weekend, so we had to use them again but they look like cheap crap. I'm shopping for replacements today but will never but a Govino product again.
customer_reviews.author: thetravelczarina

customer_reviews.title: not compatible with hot water
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was very happy with these. The first time I "hand washed" them as they recommended, they turned into a soft deformed pile of crap. I wasn't aware you had to use ice cold water. I think a paper Dixie cup would hold up better. ONE TIME USE.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Magoulas

customer_reviews.title: They look like disposable plastic cups
customer_reviews.text: They look like disposable plastic cups. If I am able to reuse these more than 3 times I will be surprised. For the price I expected something that was more substantial.....In fact when I saw the small box, I thought how much did I pay for these. When I saw the product I looked up the price.....it was about 3x what I think it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Snow country family

customer_reviews.title: I got the wrong size
customer_reviews.text: These are nice but very small. I thought the 12 oz would be huge but was wrong. I kept for party guest but I'm not going to use. The small size I got would be good for those who don't really drink much. The indentation is great for swirling and easy to hold
customer_reviews.author: Csaw

customer_reviews.title: Stylish but unbreakable for outdoor use specially poolside
customer_reviews.text: Safe for use around the pool or shatter proof bathroom glass. Holds nice amount of beverage. Only disappointment is it cannot be washed in dishwasher. Proud to use nicely designed glass at outdoor social gatherings.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne C.

customer_reviews.title: Clear Solo Cup - I fill you up..
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but should be a thicker acrylic. This is really about the thickness of a double stack solo cup (if you cut the lip off that reinforces the cup). It flexes too much just by picking it up and is too light to set down empty and expect it to stay even in a light breeze for a glass that's not disposable. Price should have been much cheaper to reflect what you're getting. That being said the thumb cutout is an awesome idea and the reason I purchased this over others that I looked at.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Martian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for outdoor living!
customer_reviews.text: We have a great outdoor party space and these are a must. I was tired of cleaning up glass and the old plastic ones I had were really stressed looking. These are super nice.
customer_reviews.author: SDCJane

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure she will love them.
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a present for my mom. I thought they would be a little sturdier. I'm sure she will love them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy!
customer_reviews.text: When I first felt the glasses, I was not super impressed, only because I thought they would feel more like glass. However, I love that they are shatter proof and the little thumb or finger slot is awesome! I've gotten many compliments about them and they are perfect for parties! I might even buy another set for a friend. They'd make a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Denney

customer_reviews.title: We love these glasses
customer_reviews.text: We love these glasses! I have become somewhat of a klutz in my later years, and these have saved me much glass clean-up. We take these when traveling for a nightcap or a drink around the pool. We plan to take them on our next cruise as well. We prefer to mix our own, and many cruise lines let you pre-order bar service to have set up in your cabin. My only uncertainty is just how "crushable" they are when jammed in a suitcase!
customer_reviews.author: Grandmarolls

customer_reviews.title: Use them for more than just wine
customer_reviews.text: Almost didn't buy these because of some of the negative reviews, but we're glad we did! I guess it all depends on what you're expecting. We hand wash them and after two months of daily use they still look new (we don't have a dishwasher in our RV). Yes, they're plastic and they flex, but I wound't compare them to SOLO cups. We now use them for almost everything... OJ in the morning, soda in the afternoon, wine in the evening. If and when they wear out, we'll be getting more. Only downside is they are a little expensive for what you get, but they work perfectly for us.
customer_reviews.author: MikeF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely without a doubt the best of both worlds. I have a personal policy to not drink wine from plastic. But when I found these I made an exception to that rule. They feel just like my favorite wine glass, and look like glass, but they are a super durable plastic that you can hand wash and use over and over again. You don't want to put your Govino's in the dishwasher or they'll melt. I love serving smoothies in them and ice cream floats. Amazon has them at a great price too.
customer_reviews.author: SuperTwinsMom

customer_reviews.title: They won't break!
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept. Glass is a pretty flexible. Good or bad....you have to decide. Wine still tastes great!
customer_reviews.author: Don W

customer_reviews.title: Fabulously Functional
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect - shatter-proof, light weight, great design, thumb grip, and awesome drinking glasses. Perfect for the boat as they fit in cup holders and are unbreakable. The material is thin and looks like glass...it's not until you touch it that you realize it's feather weight and durable. We've even given these to young kids to drink from since they're easy to hold and they can't be damaged. Great alternative to unattractive plastic cups and bring some class to your outdoor events.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: These are not glass but are very flimsy plastic ware. Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: These are not glass but are very flimsy plastic ware. They advertise they are disposable. What in the world is the sense of paying $20+ for (4) "beer glass" that wont break if you're suppose to throw it away (aka recycle). Who cares if it won't break you're going to throw it away when "it loses is luster". Misleading. Poor Quality. More plastic to float around in the pacific. Do not waste your money, looking any further. Buy glass ware, smash it poolside and it will be less frustrating than wasting your time searching, spending, waiting, overcoming disappointment, returning and smacking yourself in the face for not abiding by this feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Gent430

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Love these glasses for the patio! Would recommend for people who spend time outside and don’t want to have broken glass around!
customer_reviews.author: Nnnnjjjjjj

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE GLASS
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT waste your money !!! I bought 8 of these, and out of those 8 , only 3 sat flat and didn't wobble. ALL the other ones wobbled and didn't sit flat. For the money it's not worth it !!! Or I just got a bad batch.....
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love these glasses
customer_reviews.text: I originally saw these in the Museum of Modern Art Gift Shop! They are fantastic. I have given them as a gift countless times. They are perfect for the beach, in an RV, around the pool and everywhere else you don't want to have glass breakage. They are thin enough to feel nice to drink out of and don't have that 'plastic' feel of ordinary plastic ware. I use them in my motor home and store them in their plastic bags so they won't scratch when the motor home is in transit.
customer_reviews.author: carrie

customer_reviews.title: Saw these items at high end vineyard
customer_reviews.text: These are very packable nice glasses. The kit was almost double the cost at the vineyard and this was a great value.
customer_reviews.author: James Ciotti

customer_reviews.title: These are great for patio drinking - don't have to worry about ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great for patio drinking - don't have to worry about breakage at all. Read some reviews that the lip is sharp, but I didn't find that to be true. I wash them by hand (definitely would not suggest dishwasher), and they're fine after about 10 uses so far. Thumb grip is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie

customer_reviews.title: ... - even if you think the top shelf is fine. I have a friend that got them too ...
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention to the instructions - do not put them in the dishwasher - even if you think the top shelf is fine. I have a friend that got them too and put them in the dishwasher and now the rim is definitely wavy. They are great for outside and inside alike. We found the quality to be good. Enjoy them, take care of them and you will have them a long time. :) Nancy
customer_reviews.author: John 35

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap.... Note HAND WASH!
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight..... Which might be good for some, but It does not fee like a wine glass... It feels cheap! I also missed the "hand wash only!" Apparently there are 2 styles DW safe and hand wash..... I'll be returning these!
customer_reviews.author: Annette O.

customer_reviews.title: So useful!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for picnic drinking, movie theater drinking or a day at the beach! They are great -buy now!
customer_reviews.author: H. Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Cheap, Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Could not believe how flimsy these glasses were! Seams showed on either side. Would not trust drinking wine out of these for fear it would land on a carpet. The sad part was it cost nearly half the product cost to ship it back. A real rip off...
customer_reviews.author: Guitar Man

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for entertaining
customer_reviews.text: These are great for outdoor entertaining as well as picnicking. They can go on the top shelf of the dishwasher too! Ive given these as gifts and added them to gift baskets too! They are lightweight but not flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent worryproof wine glass!
customer_reviews.text: We were introduced to these glasses at the Coppola winery in Sonoma, which has a pool and serves all its poolside drinks out of Govino glasses. For an inexpensive plastic vessel, the glass has a very refined feel with a nice thin edge and a great shape for many wines. And if you have small kids or clumsy pets or like to BBQ or have a pool, these are perfect. We actually use them all the time for wine and beer because they're so easy to wash and fun to use -- our fine Austrian wine glasses are getting lonely!
customer_reviews.author: Ariel P.

customer_reviews.title: Whoops! These are made of plastic, duh.
customer_reviews.text: So, I may not have read the reviews or product description thoroughly enough before purchasing. These are indeed shatterproof, but they are also plastic. Most likely an oversight on my part, but they are still very handy!
customer_reviews.author: Aubberssssss

customer_reviews.title: Looks like glass, works well!
customer_reviews.text: They do look like a real wine glass. The thumb notch does make it easy to hold. After breaking a wine glass, we bought these. Easy to wash and we like them so far and we don’t have to worry about breaking glasses anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Klone

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for wine. Nice to hold and wine has great taste and clarity. I didn't believe it until I used them.
customer_reviews.author: RNRita

customer_reviews.title: Kind of thin and cheap
customer_reviews.text: This were a disappointment. The plastic is very thin. I can even bend it some.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Brino

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR TRAVEL
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are so comfortable in my hand. They are thin like glass and do not smell like plastic. I have always hated drinking wine out of plastic, but for some reason these plastic glasses do not affect the wine drinking experience. I packed them in a huge suitcase by stuffing socks in them and cushioned them around my clothing and they traveled perfectly. They would be great for camping, boating and picnicking. Now my friend is going to by them for her trailer. Hand wash only. Why would someone put this glass in the dishwasher? It was obvious to me that they would not withstand the heat of a dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: That RN

customer_reviews.title: Like 'em!
customer_reviews.text: Like these a lot. Like that they have an indentation too for your thumb, in order to grip it better. Just wish it was a little sturdier (thicker). I think if you had a crowd at your house and yhou were using these glasses, some people might think they were throw-away because they're so thin. I just make sure to let people know NOT to throw them out - and DO NOT PUT THEM IN A DISHWASHER!!!! They will melt!!!
customer_reviews.author: thebonz0

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome. Very lightweight and not breakable
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. Very lightweight and not breakable. Perfect for drinking outside with kids and concrete and toys flying around.
customer_reviews.author: Emily S.

customer_reviews.title: great for the RV and now use at home .
customer_reviews.text: Great to just hold.Would be nice to put in dishwasher, ,I might try on the top rack.
customer_reviews.author: Alan S

customer_reviews.title: These are great, I love the cut our for your finger ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great, I love the cut our for your finger to rest on. These were perfect for our Christmas after party party! Easy to was and reuse, will keep these for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: TONIA D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome size and shape
customer_reviews.text: The size and shape of these glasses are awesome. I truly love them. The plastic is THIN as noted by others and definitely not dishwasher safe as my husband found out the hard way. But I have three more and I can only drink out of one at a time! These will be great for camping but I like using them on my desk where I'm less likely to knock one over than a stemmed glass.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for! Obviously, you ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for! Obviously, you cannot put these in the dishwasher, so all of the reviews complaining about issues that occurred from putting them through the dishwasher can only blame themselves. I hand wash them and they hold up perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: KMeyer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Just perfect.
customer_reviews.text: These really do look like crystal - until you pick one up. One caveat I learned the hard way. They are so light that when pouring they have a tendency to skate forward of the pour a bit, so go slowly and hang onto the glass the first time or two that you use them. I hand wash and dry mine and they look like the day I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: David A Saltzman

customer_reviews.title: Nice, light, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient for outdoors use, and light weight. The groove/notch in the side make holding easier.
customer_reviews.author: doc

customer_reviews.title: Let's Get the Party Started!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these "glasses"! Am not afraid to bring them outside, to the pool, beach or patio. No glass to worry about! Makes nice housewarming gift, too. (bring these & a bottle of wine! )
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Kinda flimsy, but also kinda great....
customer_reviews.text: I was thinking these would be more like acrylic, and a bit more sturdy...but they're about 1.5 steps up from a red solo cup. That being said, they work. And they won't break outside, or inside, or in the bathtub, or anywhere else. Are they fancy? No, but they do their job. And after a few glasses of whine, I don't really care about the glass anymore ;)
customer_reviews.author: itsmesara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Pool
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my parents for Christmas. They have a pool and their main rule is "No glass by the pool". So they are always apologizing to guests when they are serving them wine in plastic cups out there and whatnot. So I searched for these and they loved them!! They look like real glass and are pretty. My parents were happy with them, so I am happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Coraline Jones

customer_reviews.title: So Thin Will Chafe Upper Lip..Revieew Summary Manipulated?
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is so thin that it was very rough on my upper limp..definetly do not give as gift as you will be embarrased. I read most recent reviews and compare to the rating summaries and feel someone has manipulated the ratings as these are NOT something you will want.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia K. Reeber

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love these for outside near the pool. Can be used for any type of drink, even though they are classified as wine glasses. Takes the worry out of using glass near cement areas and good for kids as well.
customer_reviews.author: NRS

customer_reviews.title: Like the thumb grip though and perfect for outdoor entertaining
customer_reviews.text: A little flimsier than I expected. Like the thumb grip though and perfect for outdoor entertaining
customer_reviews.author: Mere

customer_reviews.title: ... ordered 4 more as the in breakable nature was perfect for our situation
customer_reviews.text: We received 4 as a gift and immediately ordered 4 more as the in breakable nature was perfect for our situation. They are advertised as dish water safe. This statement is not correct. Two of ours or now seriously misshapen and barely usable. We will now hand wash. If you are willing to hand wash they seem like an acceptable product.
customer_reviews.author: McCrea Wallace

customer_reviews.title: They look nice but not very stable
customer_reviews.text: Thought they were nice until we used them and they are wobbly. The bottom of the cup protrudes so their not stable. I wouldn't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: DH

product_meta.title: Govino Wine Glass Flexible Shatterproof Recyclable, Set of 4
product_meta.description: Item Package Quantity:1| Size:4 CTUnbreakable, reusable, and recyclable Made from food-safe BPA-Free polymer Looks and performs like glass Ergonomic thumb notch for easy holding Hand washing is recommended
feature_bullets: The Govino Go Anywhere Wine Glass Performs Better Than Plastic, Acrylic, Silicone And Polycarbonate Glassware Or Red Solo Cups, Making Govino The Ideal Choice For Your Travel & Drinkware Needs.
Designed For Fine Wine, Govino Glasses Also Serve As A Great Spirits, Liquor, Cocktail, Whiskey, Port, Beer Glass.
Leave Them At Home Or Bring Your Govino Anywhere. To The Beach, At The Golf or Tennis Club, By The Pool, On A Boat, Camping, Anywhere You Need, Govino Can Conveniently Travel With You
The Award Winning Govino Wineglass Is Actually Not Made From Glass At All. It Is Made From A Food Safe, BPA-Free Polymer Which Reflects A Wine’s Color And Aromatics Much Like Crystal.
Each Tote Comes With A Set Of Four Crystal-Clear Shatterproof “Glasses” That Are As At Home At A Picnic Or Party As They Are Poolside, Polo Club, Port-Side Or Even A La Playa.

specifications.Department: Home, kitchen, dining, dinnerware, tableware, glassware & drinkware
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,702 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
